content:
Let's focus on the train pass calculation first, and then I can try to help you with the coffee shop recommendation.

Okay, so you take the train 20 times a month, and each ticket costs $6. That means your current monthly spend on individual tickets is:

20 tickets/month × $6/ticket = $120/month

Hmm, that's interesting - your monthly spend on individual tickets is exactly the same as the cost of a monthly pass! In this case, buying a monthly pass would break even with your current spend. You wouldn't save any money, but you wouldn't lose any either. The pass might still be a good option if you value the convenience of not having to buy individual tickets every day.

Now, about that coffee shop recommendation... I'd be happy to help, but I need a bit more information. Can you please tell me the city or neighborhood where your office is located? That way, I can try to suggest some popular coffee shops in the area.
